name: Holiday Inn Express Cathedral City (Palm Springs)

reviews.text: My sister and I attended the Stagecoach music festival in Indio this last weekend. The staff was super nice to us, even at 2:00am and helped with everything from directions to additional lotion. The continental breakfast was entirely edible. The rooms were clean and bright. And, most important, there was no shortage of hot water for our multiple showers. We have already planned on staying there next year as they were one of the few hotels how did not raise prices just for festival goers. The last, honest, hotel in the desert. I salute you! Thanks.
reviews.title: Nice Place, Nice Staff, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I’m a wheelchair (paraplegic T10) user travelling from Dublin, Ireland with my wife visiting friends nearby in Indian Wells. The facilities of the handicap room and staff service attention are excellent and our ground floor rear facing room gave us a view of a clear open area across the swimming pool. The pool was quite active in the morning by those finishing breakfast and having a second nap on the sun lounges. Breakfast is an ample supply of coffee, scrambled egg, bacon or sausage patties, cereals & juices all included in the overnight stay of just $110. Very good value.
reviews.title: Excellent service & wheeclhair facilities

likes.liked: — The friendliness & helpfullness of staff, quiteness of area and local market and shops access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a quiet area and tucked in behind a gas station on Date Palm Avenue. It could be easy to miss driving by. I didn't miss it as the car GPS brought me right there. Beside the hotel is a small shopping mall which has a supermarket, cafes and Reilly’s Irish Pub & Restaurant, all handy for immediate needs. This pub was only open 12 days when I checked them out and enjoyed an excellent dinner and some congenial Irish company. There were plenty of locals there too. It’s obviously popular as all the Guinness was sold out when I was there. Otherwise it’s a drive to the local shopping mall areas which are easy to get too as there was little traffic in the area most days.
reviews.title: Could be a nice place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room 103 is the handicap room to ask for if you need it, which has a large shower area. It’s a stretch to reach to the shower controls though if your balance is not good. There is no actual bath and access to the toilet and sink is ok. I've added some photos of the bathroom which might assist others.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: It has one king-size bed at the perfect height for the wheelchair with coffee making, fridge facilities and large TV
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Stayed one night
reviews.text: My work partner and I stayed one night there. The GM, I think her name was Melinda Jennings (?) was more than friendly and helpful. Her evening staff were equally as helpful in directing us where to eat.

The rooms were exceptionally clean and well kept. I like the new bedding style. No more cooties in the bedspreads, SINCE THERE ARE NONE, and no more worrying about sanitation in the drinking glasses since they are now styrofoam and sani-wrapped.
reviews.title: Good stop over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simple, but WORRY FREE. That's what I liked about it.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast (included) was as good as could be expected for having a minimal kitchen. I can't complain, it was included.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: There are plenty of eateries nearby and I particularly liked Luther's BBQ joint in the next plaza. Friendly owner and good chow.
reviews.title: Nice hotel. Beautiful pool area.

likes.disliked: — A lack of many food outlets within walking distance

reviews.title: Good hotel in good location
reviews.text: This is a modern, clean hotel which we chose for its convenient location, just off Hwy 111. You know what you're getting in a Hoilday Inn Express and this delivers it all - although the breakfast choice was perhaps below average for the chain, everything else matched up. Sound proofing of rooms was slightly inadequate as we could hear noise from other rooms. The best choice for dining seemed to be a small complex called 'The River' in Rancho Mirage - about 2 miles from the hotel on Hwy 111 - where there were four dining options - Piero's Acqua Pazza, Cheesecake Factory, PF Chang's and Babe's. We ate al fresco at the first of these and had a great meal (I can strongly recommend it!)

I was pleasently surprised at how nice this hotel was. We booked it last minute and got a very nice room that had a view of the pool. But then again all the back rooms have a pool view. I loved the sheets and comforters on the bed and the soft and firm pillows were probably my favorite. It's a nice neat and simple hotel that I will deffinitly stay at again.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: And the cinnamon rolls a pretty good.
reviews.title: Vile, noisy and inconsiderate

likes.disliked: — screaming kids at night at the pool

reviews.title: Great stay for a low price.
reviews.text: If this were just another bland McHotel stay then I probably wouldn't be writing a review. The Holiday Inn Express in Cathedral City is a basic vanilla hotel with absolutely nothing to distinguish it. Clean, modern and .....well, that's it. Two things have turned me into the person typing this. 1) a morning coffee arrangement with only non-dairy creamer products - the ultimate in cheap and "we can't be bothered to make even as much effort as the 7-11." I mean, please, I expect that at a Motel 6, but this is a Holiday Inn and I'm paying $125 a night so that I can go to a gas station to get an actual milk product in my morning coffee? 2) my real gripe involves a noisy pool. It is 10 pm right now and there are 8 kids screaming at the top of their lungs down at the pool. I ask the front desk if they can either move me to a room on the other side of the hotel or ask the people at the pool to stop screaming. Hotel front desk response, "we are fully booked up and the pool is open till 11 pm." So, fine. Stay here at your own risk and pray that there are no inconsiderate parents who don't think there is anything wrong with having their children SCREAMING at 10 pm in public. The hotel management is cheap and utterly uninterested in making any effort at keeping your fellow guests civil.
Seems better than the average Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: Definitely a consideration...but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with this place, just nothing special. It's exactly what you would expect from this chain -- basic but comfortable rooms kept immaculately clean with a better-than-average breakfast included with the room. It was very quiet the one night we stayed there, which is always a plus. However, if you're looking for the classic Palm Springs vacation, you might be disappointed. The pool was fine, just nothing special. It was in the back of the hotel overlooking a rather ugly, empty piece of land. There is no food service onsite other than the breakfast and vending machines. The hotel is located on a commercial street nextdoor to a super market and behind a gas station. No resort feeling whatsoever. My sense is the place is more geared to business travelers than vacationers. But luckily, tourist-oriented places (restaurants, shopping, golf) are a relatively short drive away.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: While following the sentiment of reviews of this hotel, I booked it. When I arrived at the hotel, I was very pleased with the upkeep, the cleanliness, the room, the bathroom, the pool, and pretty much everything else. I am so glad the reviews on Trip Advisor were right. We had friends who wanted us to stay at the Travelodge with them. I am glad we didn't, we passed it and I thought I saw Norman Bate's mom in the window. Back to Holiday, I WILL definitely book here again if and when we return. The crowd was pleasant, too. Everyone was drinking and eating down at the pool. No one was out of control and everyone did pick up all their trash. It was nice to know that the people who stayed there were considerate of others. Although, I don't have any photos to share, I am sure you won't be sorry at this hotel.
reviews.title: VERY pleasant stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in room 303, King Room, connects to 301, pool side. Everything I've come to expect from Holiday Inn Express. Room was clean and well kept. Air conditioning worked well, if a little loud! Pool is clean and well maintained with plenty of lounge chairs. We enjoyed lounging there most of the day. Breakfast was great for being free! The biscuits and gravy were my favorite!
reviews.title: Good choice in Cathedral City

likes.disliked: — Thin walls and alarm's in the middle of the night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alarm next door went off at 4.45 am and didn't stop! We called down after 45 minutes of waiting for it to stop. Someone had left it on, but the staff were up in 2 minutes to turn it off. Walls are quite thin, you could hear your next door neighbor, but thicker than a Westin I stayed at recently!
reviews.title: We loved this hotel.

reviews.text: A bulb was out in our room, i never mentioned it, never the less after our first night a maid showed up bulb in hand to replace it. Pretty good considering she'd have to randomly try the light and then have the initiative to fix it!
reviews.title: nice place

aka: Holiday Inn Express Cathedral City (Palm Springs) Hotel
description: The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Cathedral City is conveniently located in the heart of Palm Springs Valley. Our Cathedral City Hotel is a resort destination near Rancho Mirage, La Quinta, Palm Desert, Indian Wells, world class golf courses, spas, casinos, restaurants and shopping. While travelling to our hotel, you will be able to visit the Palm Springs Aerial Tramway, Indian Canyon Trails, Spa Casino, Agua Caliente Casino, Cathedral Canyon Golf, PGA West Golf, Cabazon World Premium Outlet Mall, Knotts Soak City, Empire Polo Grounds, El Paseo Shopping District, The Living Desert and Joshua Tree National Park. This Holiday Inn Express Hotel is a host hotel for The Big League Dreams Sports Park. We are just minutes from the Palm Springs International Airport in CA. Also nearby Palm Springs Convention Center, Downtown shopping, restaurants, and Indian Wells Tennis Gardens. All leisure or business guests will enjoy our high speed, wireless and wired Internet and complimentary business center. Come experience our serene outdoor heated pool and whirlpool with a large deck and mountain views. Our hotel also features a workout room. Our 100% smoke free hotel features the comforts of home. From our resort style pool, wonderful cinnamon rolls, cookies in the lobby every evening, and the Simply Smart Bedding Collection, this hotel in Cathedral City, CA is sure to please.
